title: Good Place
review: Its a good place. You will find the real peace there. All must visit this place. Its Mahadev mandir. Location is good.

title: Crowded but nice
review: Possibly one of hte most crowded temples of Dehradun. The temple itself is very nice. The compound is extensive with shops etc. A must stop for a lot of people going up or down Mussoorie

title: Temple based tourism
review: There is not enough parking space in front of the temple. There are cases of encroachment against the temple. Way back in the early 1990's they started with offering free water to the travelers and graduated to serving free tea and snacks. I wonder how they run the show. Is its through Gems and stones ?

title: 'Blessings from Sphatik Shivlingas' on the way to Mussoorie
review: Shri Prakasheshwar Mahadev Temple is a Lord Shiva's worship place where no money is accepted by the temple. No Donation whatsoever.

title: A break on the way to Mussoorie
review: We took a break to visit this famous temple on the way to Mussoorie, it was crowded and took a bit to find parking place. One of the unique temples where there is no donation or money accepted. They are providing tea and prasadam without any charges. We had that and sat for few minutes.

title: God’s house
review: Situated on Dehradun-Mussorie highway. It belongs to Lord Shiva and very huge complex with shop inbuilt for purchasing stones etc. Mandir does not accept any kind of offerings but distributes very good prasad to devotees.

title: Temple with no donations
review: We stopped by a temple - where no donations are taken - Shree Prakasheswar Mahadev Mandir. The temple has big lingas made of Spatika and offers food and tea for all pilgrims. We spent around 10 minutes at the temple and shops within.

title: Greatest Temple
review: This is a very large temple. It is crowded very fiercely. You can spend hours here easily.  Food Arrangements are made for the devotees on behalf of the temple, so be assured. The best part is there is no need to donate as the donation is completely closed here.

title: Beautiful temple
review: This temple is very beautiful, on the way to Dehradun from Mussoorie. The temple has a huge linga. The prasad is very tasty.

title: Temple with some difference
review: This Shiva temple is located on the main road between Dehradun and Mussourie, which is spread over a large area and the exceptional feature observed was that they do not seek donations.  Food is also served.  I failed to understand, how do they do this activity, without any revenue stream?

title: Great temple of lord shiva in between dehradun mussorie highway  No Donation
review: I visited at the time of heavy rain & awesome weather , temple is very peaceful & amazing This is the place where u can feel inner peace and divin chant of lord shiva

title: Peaceful temple
review: As it is with all temples , the place is peaceful from the hustle of the city. It houses a good size idol of Shiva and there are many stories about the temple
